a-lot-of-websites-collect-personal-infor: A lot of websites collect personal information to sell you ads or other products. Some times this is pretty sneaky and happening without you knowing or saying it is ok. That is bad for your privacy. <strong>We designed our website to not do that.</strong
any-other-details-about-your-experience: Any other details about your experience...
at-the-top-right-click-the-strongmenu-bu: At the top right, click the menu button (☰) and select Settings.
at-the-top-right-select-strongmore-stron: At the top right, select More ▼ and then Delete browsing data.
but-we-also-know-that-strongprivacy-is-v: But we also know that privacy is very important, especially when it comes to sensitive health information like addiction. We want to make sure you are safe when using this tool, so we ve taken steps to protect your privacy. There are some steps you can take too, which we ll explain below.
copy-the-secure-link-it-generates: Copy the secure link it generates.
do-not-include-any-personally-identifiab: Do not include any personally identifiable information in the notes. Simulated patient info can be included in the notes (e.g., pregnant) if relevant.
do-this-each-time-you-visit-this-site: Do this each time you visit this site.
email-that-single-link-to-us-at-strongco: Email that single link to us at: <strong>code[at]opioidpolicy[dot]org</strong
for-researchers-conducting-secret-shoppe: For researchers conducting secret shopper studies or organizations with multiple data points (pharmacy chains??? peer recovery coaches??? prescribers??? harm reduction orgs???), we offer a bulk submission option to help populate the map quickly.
how-we-try-to-protect-your-privacy: How We Try to Protect Your Privacy
if-you-couldn-t-find-your-pharmacy-in-th: If you couldn t find your pharmacy in the search results, you can add it here along with your report about filling your prescription.
if-you-have-bulk-data-you-can-help-us-qu: If you have bulk data, you can help us quickly fill out the map. Thank you!
if-you-re-interested-in-submitting-multi: If you re interested in submitting multiple reports, check out our bulk reporting tool.
learn-more-about-privacy-practices-on-pr: Learn more about privacy practices on Privacy Guides.
like-with-our-other-projects-we-built-th: Like with our other projects, we built this in response to a need without any financial support. We also don t wait for external validation from granting organizations. If it needs to be done, we ll do it.
nb-the-file-link-is-only-active-for-24hr: NB - the file link is only active for 24hrs so I might ask you to resend it. Apologies in advanced!
nb-there-might-be-a-world-where-this-dat: NB There might be a world where this data is used for research or funders see the value and throw us a few bones. If that s the case we ll update this page.
no-successful-reports-found-for-the-sele: No successful reports found for the selected time period. Try a wider date range or select  All Time .
no-tracking-no-ads-privacy-first-design: No tracking • No ads • Privacy-first design
optional-personal-information-we-do-coll: Optional personal information we do collect
our-most-important-promise-is-to-protect: Our most important promise is to protect your privacy. We have designed this site to collect zero personal information about you. The submission form is just enough information to be useful to other people and not identify you.
please-reach-out-using-our-secure-form-i: Please reach out using our secure form if you have questions or suggestions.
remember-to-clear-your-browser-history: Remember to clear your browser history.
research-working-to-understand-moud-barr: Research working to understand MOUD barriers can be broken down into two categories: issues with finding a prescriber and issues with filling a prescription. Prior research related to finding a prescriber has highlighted longstanding barriers to care such as unethical admission practices among OUD treatment providers, MOUD prescriber deserts, and negative perceptions towards people with an OUD. Solutions to the prescriber problem have included reducing prescriber training requirements, incentivizing providers, and stigma reduction education for providers. While these examples highlight the massive challenge of finding a prescriber to provide life-saving care, the second issue, filling a prescription, can reduce a person s ability to start or continue their medication.
select-how-much-history-you-want-to-dele: Select how much history you want to delete (e.g.,  Last hour,   All time ).
select-the-time-range-to-clear-eg-everyt: Select the time range to clear (e.g.,  Everything ).
sorry-the-page-you-re-looking-for-doesn-: Sorry, the page you re looking for doesn t exist.
subscribe-to-our-newsletter-for-organizi: Subscribe to our newsletter for organizing and updates
the-only-information-we-need-for-a-repor: The only information we need for a report is what you choose to share: the pharmacy s name, pharmacy location, the date, and whether your visit was a success or a denial. There are other questions you can choose to answer, but you do not have to. Do not submit personal information in the notes form. If you do, we will delete it from our database.
the-only-required-fields-are-pharmacy_ad: The only required fields are pharmacy_address, report_type (success or denied). Information about formulation, standardized_notes, and notes are optional (but useful!).
the-last-mile-problem-is-the-treatment-g: The “last mile” problem is the treatment gap created by pharmacy discretion over what MOUD is stocked (if any) and how it is dispensed by pharmacies. While much of the federal policy related to the opioid epidemic has focused on increasing MOUD prescribing among prescribers, pharmacies ultimately decide whether MOUD is dispensed. Inability to fill a prescription at the pharmacy negates all progress made by increasing prescribers.
there-are-two-main-ways-we-collect-infor: There are two main ways we collect information about you with this site
this-project-aims-to-address-this: This project aims to address this.
this-will-open-your-device-s-map-applica: This will open your device s map application. Please be aware that
upload-your-tsv-file-tab-separated-value: Upload your TSV file (tab separated values).
use-privacy-preserving-mapping-apps-like: Use privacy preserving mapping apps like Organic Maps
use-the-spreadsheet-template-below-to-fi: Use the spreadsheet template below to fill in your data. This format is important for batch uploading.
we-strongdo-notstrong-know-your-email-or: We do not know your email or phone number.
we-also-hope-to-shine-a-light-on-just-ho: We also hope to shine a light on just how big an issue this is. Among people touched by this issue, it s well known, but few outside those spaces know just how hard it is to get treatment for an opioid addiction. Policy fixes to date have been inadequate. While this database might not be comprehensive, we hope it starts a conversation and action towards meaningfully closing these gaps.
we-built-this-tool-to-help-it-s-a-map-ma: We built this tool to help. It s a map, made by the community, for the community. By sharing which pharmacies are helpful, we can make it easier for the next person to get the medicine they need. We can also show how big the problem is, so we can work to fix it.
we-designed-our-website-to-not-do-that: We designed our website to not do that.
we-don-t-track-or-store-your-location: We don t track or store your location
we-hope-that-this-platform-will-help-peo: We hope that this platform will help people help people get medicine and break the cycle of discrimination against people who use drugs or have an addiction.
we-re-having-trouble-loading-this-conten: We re having trouble loading this content.
we-use-a-standard-template-to-ensure-dat: We use a standard template to ensure data quality. Please view or download our official CryptPad template.
we-use-modern-privacy-focused-tools-to-r: We use modern, privacy-focused tools to run this site
we-will-take-care-of-formatting-and-uplo: We will take care of formatting and uploading to the map!
what-we-collect-and-what-we-don-t: What We Collect (and What We Don t
what-formulations-did-you-try-to-fill: What formulation(s) did you try to fill?
what-would-you-like-to-do-today: What would you like to do today?
when-it-comes-to-information-like-who-yo: When it comes to information like who you are, if you had an addiction, what medicine you take, or where you live, people and companies can use that to discriminate against you. So, we do not give that information or any other information about you to other companies.
when-you-are-done-you-can-also-clear-you: When you are done, you can also clear your recent browser history to remove any trace of your visit
while-our-website-strives-to-be-secure-a: While our website strives to be secure and protect your privacy, your own web browser saves a history of the sites you visit. If you are using a shared computer, we strongly recommend using  Private  or  Incognito  mode in your browser. This deletes your history when you close the browser window, so no one else can see what sites you visited. It might be good to clear your browser history after using this site, even if not on a shared computer. This can help protect your privacy.
your-map-application-may-collect-and-sha: Your map application may collect and share your location data
